content: <collection xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/MARC21/slim"> <record>   <controlfield tag="001">8404</controlfield>   <controlfield tag="005">20140312190600.0</controlfield>   <datafield tag="711" ind1=" " ind2=" ">     <subfield code="c">Victoria, Canada</subfield>     <subfield code="a">28th IEEE International Conference on Advanced Information Networking and Applications</subfield>     <subfield code="g">AINA 2014</subfield>     <subfield code="d">13-16 May 2014</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="856" ind1="4" ind2=" ">     <subfield code="z">0</subfield>     <subfield code="u">http://zenodo.org/record/8404/files/KHAN2014_IEEE_AINA.pdf</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="856" ind1="4" ind2=" ">     <subfield code="u">http://zenodo.org/record/8404/files/KHAN2014_IEEE_AINA.png?subformat=icon-90</subfield>     <subfield code="x">icon-90</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="856" ind1="4" ind2=" ">     <subfield code="y">Conference website</subfield>     <subfield code="u">http://www.aina-conference.org/2014/</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="909" ind1="C" ind2="O">     <subfield code="o">oai:zenodo.org:8404</subfield>     <subfield code="p">user-clommunity</subfield>     <subfield code="p">user-zenodo</subfield>     <subfield code="p">user-ecfunded</subfield>     <subfield code="p">openaire</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="980" ind1=" " ind2=" ">     <subfield code="a">user-clommunity</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="980" ind1=" " ind2=" ">     <subfield code="a">user-zenodo</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="980" ind1=" " ind2=" ">     <subfield code="a">user-ecfunded</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="980" ind1=" " ind2=" ">     <subfield code="b">conferencepaper</subfield>     <subfield code="a">publication</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="536" ind1=" " ind2=" ">     <subfield code="c">288535</subfield>     <subfield code="a">CONFINE - Community Networks Testbed for the Future Internet (288535)</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="536" ind1=" " ind2=" ">     <subfield code="c">317879</subfield>     <subfield code="a">CLOMMUNITY - A Community networking Cloud in a box (317879)</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="653" ind1="1" ind2=" ">     <subfield code="a">cloud computing</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="653" ind1="1" ind2=" ">     <subfield code="a">community networks</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="653" ind1="1" ind2=" ">     <subfield code="a">incentive mechanisms</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="653" ind1="1" ind2=" ">     <subfield code="a">resource allocation</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="245" ind1=" " ind2=" ">     <subfield code="a">Prototyping Incentive-based Resource Assignment for Clouds in Community Networks</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="542" ind1=" " ind2=" ">     <subfield code="l">open</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="520" ind1=" " ind2=" ">     <subfield code="a"><p>Wireless community networks are a successful example of a collective where communities operate ICT infrastructure and provide IP connectivity based on the principle of reciprocal resource sharing of network bandwidth. This sharing, however, has not extended to computing and storage resources, resulting in very few applications and services which are currently deployed within community networks. Cloud computing, as in today&#39;s Internet, has made it common to consume resources provided by public clouds providers, but such cloud infrastructures have not materialized within community networks. We analyse in this paper socio-technical characteristics of community networks in order to derive scenarios for community clouds. Based on an architecture for such a community cloud, we implement a prototype for the incentive-driven resource assignment component, deploy it in a testbed of community network nodes, and evaluate its behaviour experimentally. Our evaluation gives insight into how the deployed prototype components regulate the consumption of cloud resources taking into account the users&#39; contributions, and how this regulation affects the system usage. Our results suggest a further integration of this regulation component into current cloud management platforms in order to open them up for the operation of an ecosystem of community cloud.</p></subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="100" ind1=" " ind2=" ">     <subfield code="u">Department of Computer Architecture, Universitat Polit\ufffd\ufffdcnica de Catalunya, Barcelona, Spain</subfield>     <subfield code="a">Khan, Amin M.</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="700" ind1=" " ind2=" ">     <subfield code="u">Department of Computer Architecture, Universitat Polit\ufffd\ufffdcnica de Catalunya, Barcelona, Spain</subfield>     <subfield code="a">B\ufffd\ufffdy\ufffd\ufffdk\ufffd\ufffdahin,  \ufffd\ufffdmit C. </subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="700" ind1=" " ind2=" ">     <subfield code="u">Department of Computer Architecture, Universitat Polit\ufffd\ufffdcnica de Catalunya, Barcelona, Spain</subfield>     <subfield code="a">Freitag, Felix</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="260" ind1=" " ind2=" ">     <subfield code="c">2014-05-13</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="024" ind1="7" ind2=" ">     <subfield code="2">DOI</subfield>     <subfield code="a">10.5281/zenodo.8404</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="540" ind1=" " ind2=" ">     <subfield code="u">http://www.opendefinition.org/licenses/cc-by</subfield>     <subfield code="a">Creative Commons Attribution</subfield>   </datafield>   <datafield tag="650" ind1="1" ind2="7">     <subfield code="a">cc-by</subfield>     <subfield code="2">opendefinition.org</subfield>   </datafield> </record> </collection>
